title: For Sale:  Spencer SRC Civil War EraModel 1865 Antique NO FFL NR .50 Rimfire
postcontent:
This Carbine is a Spencer model 1865 chambered in .50 cal. In late 1864 the army ordnance dept. ordered modifications to these guns by ordered the bore changed from 52 to 50 cal. and the barrel changed from 22" to 20". This example is one of these rifles with a 20" barrel and a .50 dia. bore. The bore is bright and has distinct lands and grooves with some pitting through out as would be expected from shooting black powder ammo. Still a very "Shootable" bore. It has military inspectors marks and all of the mechanics are in working order.
A lot of these "late war" produced carbines were the mainstay of American Troops on the western frontier until they were replaced by the Springfield "Trap Door" rifles. This gun is a lever action repeating design and I would speculate that Custer might have fared better if he would have been equipped with the Spencer Repeating Rifle. All that being said, this is a really great piece of American Military History that is getting hard to find in any kind of shootable condition. This 150 year od gun would fit great into a Military collection and would be fun to shoot with black powder ammo. It has "Antique Status" and does not require a FFL for transfer. shipping is free

title: For Sale/Trade:  WINCHESTER 1894 /FIRST YEAR PRODUCTION.
postcontent: This is a rare opportunity to own a rare piece of Winchester history. This is a Winchester 94, caliber 32-40 rifle with a 26" long, full octagon barrel and a full length tube magazine. It's the first year production and shipped to the warehouse January 15, and shipped out on January 16, 1895 on invoice 4775. Firearm is serial no. 15xx. Classified as an Antique Firearm. Fully documented by Cody Museum Letter. *Shotgun butt stock *Textured steel butt plate *Lyman front bead sight *D.W King receiver sight *Metal forearm cap *Inspector mark AMW? (not confirmed) No rust, no pits, no dents. Minor dings on forearm after 120 years. Clean, sharp bore. About perfect bluing. Condition NRA fine to excellent. Everything is tight. It has been test fired and functions fine as any Winchester should. It's not a wall hanger, I include a box of vintage Winchester ammo, a protective carry case, Bill of Sale, and the original Cody Museum Letter. This firearm has been in storage for 20 years. It has been treated well by all its owners, It now deserves a new owner to care for her for the next 120 years. It's in amazing condition. All the factory markings are sharp and crisp. Please, serious inquiries only. Partial trades given consideration. Dave
